result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey M. Bergsma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Petition for payment of attorney fees w/cover letter
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Clerk: MK]
Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 10:46am.
Defendant Casey M. Bergsma in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to St. 947.01(1) as an act of Domestic Abuse [St. 968.075(1)(a)]. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On both Count #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Bergsma on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment  
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no contact with Carmen VanCamp unless consented to by Ms. VanCamp and unless approved by the Agent 
--no acts or threats of violence against any person
--to pay costs of $243 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge plus $200 DNA surcharge on each count

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
recess 11:04am
FINANCIAL NOTES: $75.00 GPS payment received.
Status conference on June 6, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:31 pm
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Casey M. Bergsma in court with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Laitsch: Have met with ADA Teuber formally & had informal discussions. Original CCS has contemplated term of probation, have not had sufficient time to discuss with client, requests matter be set for STC and change of plea and sentencing in a couple weeks
ADA Teuber: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Bergsma that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Original bond document received from JESO on 4/15/14
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:14 pm
Defendant Casey M. Bergsma in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the defendant does not qualify for SPD representation.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
--No acts or threats of violence 
--No contact with Carmen Van Camp
--Defendant may return to the residence on one occassion with law enforcement to obtain personal belongings
--Defendant must appear at the 5/7/14 Pretrial Conference at 10:20 am and the 5/23/14 Status Conference at 2:00 pm.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:26 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 5/7/14 at 10:20 am
Status: 5/23/14 at 2:00 pm
